alert.note: Alert for Butler; Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Logan and southwestern Butler Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1032 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Dunmor, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Logan and southwestern Butler Counties, including the following locations... Insco, Diamond Springs, Davis Crossroads, Wolf Lick, Harper Crossroads, Buffalo Fork, Chandlers Chapel, Lewisburg, Anderson and Costelow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
